task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 30°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline/top to estimate total height, so I should tilt up while keeping the current heading toward the building.
The prompt specifies the building is around 30° (NE) but I’m currently facing 0°, so I should yaw right to re-center the building while keeping the upward pitch to see its top.
To estimate height I need both the base and the roofline in view, so I will keep the building centered but tilt up to capture its top.
The view has snapped back to 0° while I need ~30° NE, so I should rotate right to re-align with the building.
I should stop rotating and instead move slightly closer/left-forward to get a clearer full view of the façade for a height estimate.
I’m now slightly left of the target direction, so I should rotate right about 47° to face ~30° NE toward the building again.
With the building centered, I should tilt up to include the roofline/top so I can estimate total height from ground to roof.
The heading reset to 0° again, so I need to rotate right to approximately 47° to bring the building back into view while staying pitched up.
I have a stable view toward the building; I’ll estimate height as a ~3-story structure (≈3.3 m per story plus roof/parapet).
